trait.name: Sunbeetle Armor
entries: The knight's armor is perpetually slick. Any attempts to grapple the knight have disadvantage.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The knight has advantage on saving throws against magic and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The queensguard makes four attacks with its g'irakas, or makes three attacks and uses its immobilizing spittle once.

action.name: G'iraka
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Immobilizing Spittle
entries: The queensguard sprays thick, resinous spittle onto a creature within 30 feet. The target must make a {@dc 14} strength saving throw or become {@condition restrained} (save at end of turn ends).

reaction.name: Interception
entries: When a melee attack targeting an ally within 5 feet hits them and does damage, reduce that damage by {@damage 1d10 + 3}

spellcasting.name: Psionic Drizzle
headerEntries: The queensguard is weakly psionic ({@dc 12}). It has a heat capacity of 3 and access to the following emanations:

trait.name: Chameleon Carapace
entries: The thri-kreen can change the color of its carapace to match the color and texture of its surroundings. As a result, it has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The thri-kreen's long jump is up to 30 feet and its high jump is up to 15 feet, with or without a running start.

trait.name: Minion
entries: If the thri-kreen takes damage from an attack or as the result of a failed saving throw, their hit points are reduced to 0. If the pile takes damage from another effect, they die if the damage equals or exceeds their hit point maximum; otherwise they take no damage.

action.name: Bite (Group Attack)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}3 + Group Size piercing damage, and the target must make a {@dc 10}  + Group Size Constitution save or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target is also {@condition paralyzed} while {@condition poisoned}. REOTE. Requires a group of size 2 or more.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}2 slashing damage.
Thri-kreen wander the deserts and savannas of the world, avoiding all other races.

entries.name: Thri-Kreen Communication
entries: Thri-kreen employ a language without words. To show emotion and reaction, a thri-kreen clacks its mandibles and waves its antennae, giving other thri-kreen a sense of what it is thinking and feeling. Other creatures find this manner of communication difficult to interpret and impossible to duplicate.

When forced to interact with creatures of other intelligent species, thri-kreen employ alternative methods of communication, such as drawing pictures in sand or making pictures out of twigs or blades of grass.

entries.name: Limited Emotions
entries: Thri-kreen experience the full range of emotions but aren't as prone to emotional outbursts as humans. Thri-kreen with psionic ability often demonstrate a wider range of emotions, particularly if they live near or interact with humans or other highly emotional creatures.

entries.name: Isolationists and Wanderers
entries: Thri-kreen consider all other living creatures as potential nourishment, and they love the taste of elf flesh in particular. If a creature might be useful for something other than food, the thri-kreen aren't likely to attack it on sight. Thri-kreen kill to survive, never for sport.

entries.name: Sleepless
entries: Thri-kreen don't require sleep and can rest while remaining alert and performing light tasks. Their inability to sleep is thought to be the reason why thri-kreen have such short lifespans, the average thri-kreen life expectancy being only thirty years.

monster.name: USTAR, BLOOD DRIPPING FROM THE FANGS OF HEAVEN EXTINGUISHES ONLY THE WEAK FLAME
languages: the languages they knew in life

trait.name: Flammable
entries: Whenever the mummy takes fire damage, they take an extra 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage.

trait.name: Mummy Dust
entries: Whenever the mummy takes piercing or slashing damage, each creature within 5 feet of them takes 4 ({@damage 1d8}) poison damage.

trait.name: Deadlord of Anauroch
entries: If this creature is reduced to 0 hit points while its canopic jar remains intact, it reforms one round later at half of its maximum hit points.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The mummy makes three Desiccating Slam attacks and uses Guardian Curse.

action.name: Desiccating Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 3d6 + 4}) slashing damage. Until the start of the mummy's next turn, the target's speed is reduced by 10 feet and the target can't regain hit points.

action.name: Guardian Curse
entries: The mummy calls down a scourge on one creature they can see within 60 feet of them. The target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or be cursed. While cursed in this way, whenever the target takes damage, they take an extra 3 ({@damage 1d6}) necrotic damage that can't be reduced in any way. The curse lasts until removed by a {@i cure ailment} power, a {@spell remove curse} spell, or a similar supernatural effect. A target who succeeds on their saving throw is immune to the Guardian Curse of all mummies for the next 24 hours.

legendaryHeader: Ustar has three Villain Actions. He can use only one per round and must use them in order.

legendary.name: 1. Terror in the Night
entries: Ustar lets out an otherworldly howl, and all living creatures must make a {@dc 16} wisdom save against fear. SEOTE.
Then, Ustar can move his full movement towards a creature who failed this save.

legendary.name: 2. Devour Worlds
entries: Ustar picks up a mummy rotwrap (or scoops up their viscera if none are left alive), healing himself {@dice 3d10 + 5} hit points and gaining a bless effect for the next 10 minutes.

legendary.name: 3. FEAST OF YENOGHU
entries: Every creature cut by Ustar's claws makes a {@dc 17} CON save against delayed poison. SEOTE. Ustar cackles and pounces on one {@condition poisoned} target

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the kobold has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The kobold has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the kobold's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Sling
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

Kobolds are craven reptilian humanoids that worship evil dragons as demigods and serve them as minions and toadies. Kobolds inhabit dragons' lairs when they can but more commonly infest dungeons, gathering treasures and trinkets to add to their own tiny hoards.

entries.name: Strength in Numbers
entries: Kobolds are egg-laying creatures. They mature quickly and can live to be "great wyrms" more than a century old. However, many kobolds perish before they reach the end of their first decade. Physically weak, they are easy prey for predators. This vulnerability forces them to band together. Their superior numbers can win battles against powerful adversaries, but often with massive casualties on the kobold side.

entries.name: Tunnelers and Builders
entries: Kobolds make up for their physical ineptitude with a cleverness for trap making and tunneling. Their lairs consist of low tunnels through which they move easily but which hinder larger humanoids. Kobolds also riddle their lairs with traps. The most insidious kobold traps make use of natural hazards and other creatures. A trip wire might connect to a spring-loaded trap that hurls clay pots of flesh-eating green slime or flings crates of venomous giant centipedes at intruders.

entries.name: The Lost God
entries: In addition to the dragons they revere, kobolds worship a lesser god named Kurtulmak. Legends speak of how Kurtulmak served as Tiamat's vassal in the Nine Hells until Garl Glittergold, the god of gnomes, stole a trinket from the Dragon Queen's hoard. Tiamat sent Kurtulmak to retrieve the trinket, but Garl Glittergold played a trick on him, collapsing the earth and trapping the kobold god in an underground maze for eternity. For this reason, kobolds hate gnomes and pranks of any kind. Kurtulmak's most devoted worshipers dedicate themselves to finding and releasing their lost god from his prison-maze.

bonus.name: Sand Armor
entries: When walking on sand, the Kobold can roll around in the sand, coating their scales and providing a +1 to their AC for 1 minute.

trait.name: Chameleon Carapace
entries: The thri-kreen can change the color of its carapace to match the color and texture of its surroundings. As a result, it has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The thri-kreen's long jump is up to 30 feet and its high jump is up to 15 feet, with or without a running start.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The thri-kreen makes two attacks with its Gythka.

action.name: Gythka
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage.
Thri-kreen wander the deserts and savannas of the world, avoiding all other races.

entries.name: Thri-Kreen Communication
entries: Thri-kreen employ a language without words. To show emotion and reaction, a thri-kreen clacks its mandibles and waves its antennae, giving other thri-kreen a sense of what it is thinking and feeling. Other creatures find this manner of communication difficult to interpret and impossible to duplicate.

When forced to interact with creatures of other intelligent species, thri-kreen employ alternative methods of communication, such as drawing pictures in sand or making pictures out of twigs or blades of grass.

entries.name: Limited Emotions
entries: Thri-kreen experience the full range of emotions but aren't as prone to emotional outbursts as humans. Thri-kreen with psionic ability often demonstrate a wider range of emotions, particularly if they live near or interact with humans or other highly emotional creatures.

entries.name: Isolationists and Wanderers
entries: Thri-kreen consider all other living creatures as potential nourishment, and they love the taste of elf flesh in particular. If a creature might be useful for something other than food, the thri-kreen aren't likely to attack it on sight. Thri-kreen kill to survive, never for sport.

entries.name: Sleepless
entries: Thri-kreen don't require sleep and can rest while remaining alert and performing light tasks. Their inability to sleep is thought to be the reason why thri-kreen have such short lifespans, the average thri-kreen life expectancy being only thirty years.

spellcasting.name: Psionic Rain
headerEntries: The chakak is powerful psionic. It has 5 heat capacity, with a psionic DC of 12. It has imprints of the following emanations.

trait.name: Blood Frenzy
entries: The sahuagin has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

trait.name: Limited Amphibiousness
entries: The sahuagin can breathe air and water, but it needs to be submerged at least once every 4 hours to avoid suffocating.

trait.name: Grasp of Talona
entries: When this creature dies, it explodes in a cloud of dark pestilence. Creatures within 10 feet must make a {@dc 10} Dexterity saving throw or contract the first stages of Talona's Embrace, as well as taken {@damage 2d6} acid damage on a failed save or half on a successful one.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The sahuagin makes two melee attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws or spear.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) slashing damage.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) piercing damage, or 5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

Across fog-shrouded coasts or endless ocean swells, an ominous drone sounded on a conch shell chills the blood of all who hear it. This is the sound of the sahuagin hunting horn-a call to raid and battle. Coastal settlers refer to sahuagin as "sea devils," for sahuagin have no compassion in them, slaughtering the crews of ships and decimating coastal villages.

entries.name: Devils of the Deep
entries: Sahuagin are a predatory, piscine race that ventures from the ocean's black depths to hunt the creatures of the shallows and shore. Though they dwell in the deepest trenches of the ocean, sahuagin view the entire aquatic realm as their kingdom and the creatures in it as blood sport for their hunting parties.
The self-styled rulers of sahuagin ocean domains are massive mutant males that grow second sets of arms. They are terrible foes in battle, and all sahuagin bow down before these powerful barons.

entries.name: Way of the Shark
entries: Sahuagin worship the shark god Sekolah. Only female sahuagin are deemed worthy of channeling the god's power, and priestesses hold tremendous sway in sahuagin communities.

Sahuagin are driven into a frenzy by the smell of fresh blood. As worshipers of Sekolah, they also have a special kinship with sharks, which they train as attack animals. Even untrained sharks recognize sahuagin as allies and don't prey on them.

entries.name: Elven Enmity
entries: The sahuagin might control the oceans if not for the presence of their mortal enemies, the aquatic elves. Wars between the two races have raged for centuries across the coasts and seas of the world, disrupting maritime trade and drawing other races into the bloody conflict.

So intense is sahuagin hatred for the aquatic elves that the sea devils have adapted to combat their ancient foes. A sahuagin born near enough to an aquatic elf community can enter the world as a malenti-a sahuagin that physically resembles an aquatic elf in every way. Sahuagin are prone to mutation, but whether this rare phenomenon is a result of the wars between the sahuagin and the aquatic elves-or whether it preceded or even began the conflict-none can say.

The sahuagin put the malenti to good use as spies and assassins in aquatic elf cities and the societies of other creatures that pose a threat to sahuagin. The mere shadow of the malenti threat incites paranoia and suspicion among aquatic elves, whose resilience is weakened as the prelude to an actual sahuagin invasion.
TThe village was empty, the seagulls were strangely quiet, and all we could hear was the surge of the sea.
entries.by: An account of the aftermath of a sahuagin raid

spell.name: 「LANCE」
entries: Target a creature with a jolt of psionic energy. The target makes an Intelligence Saving Throw and takes {@damage 2d6} psychic damage on a failure.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: For every point of overclock, add {@dice 1d6} of psychic damage.

spell.name: 「SHADE」
entries: Target a creature within range to make an Intelligence Saving Throw. If the target fails their save, the caster becomes {@condition invisible} to that creature until the caster moves or takes hostile action towards the target.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: For every 2 points of overclock, add one target.

spell.name: 「CATCH」

time.condition: when hit by a melee attack

entries: The creature whose attack triggered this reaction must make an Intelligence save or be {@condition grappled} by the caster's Intelligence (Arcana).

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: For each point of overclock, the subject of this emanation receives disadvantage for one round of grapple escape checks.

spell.name: 「SLIPSHOD」
entries: Target creature makes an Intelligence Save against falling {@condition prone}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: For every 3 points of overclock, add an additional target.

spell.name: 「FIELD」
entries: The ultimate psionic emanation.

You project your psychic weave into the world around you. Creatures besides yourself within the Brain Field are unable to cast spells or invoke emanations. Any psionic effects already active within your brain field are yours control freely.

While in your brain field, you are immune to psychic damage and resist all other damage. If invoking this emanation would put the user into psionic crisis, the effects of the crisis are delayed until after the field dissipates.

If you exit the brain field or the duration of the emanation runs out, make an Intelligence Saving Throw against your psionics DC. On a successful save, take five levels of {@condition exhaustion}. On a failed save, take nine levels of {@condition exhaustion}.
If this {@condition exhaustion} is fatal, you erupt in psionic energy as if you'd reached maximum psionic crisis.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: For every 2 points of overclock, gain one less {@condition exhaustion|TomboftheMummyKingsContent} level on Brain Field collapse.

spell.name: 「EQUIP」
entries: You coil your psychic weave into a second mind. Using this mind, you are able to attune to one more magical item.
This emanation uses an ongoing effect; ongoing effects cost heat capacity instead of building up heat.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: For every 3 points of overclock, your submind can attune to one additional magic item.

spell.name: 「MIND」
entries: Touch an inanimate object while invoking this emanation. That creature is imbued with a mind and becomes an awakened object with your mental statistics.
It is loyal to you as long as this emanation is ongoing, and it can deliver your touch-emanations.

By consuming the 3 units of sublimate from the material component, your connection with this new mind is severed, ending the ongoing effect and turning the creature into a permanent, independent awakened object retaining your mental statistics.
This emanation uses an ongoing effect; ongoing effects cost heat capacity instead of building up heat.

m.text: 3 units of psionic sublimate, consumed to sever connection

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: For every 2 points of overclock, add 1 to each of the awakened object's statistics.

spell.name: 「SOAR」
entries: Target a creature while invoking this emanation. This creature must make an Intelligence Saving Throw against your psychic DC or be teleported 20 feet upwards.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: For every point of overclock, increase height by 10 feet.

spell.name: 「EQUALIZE」
entries: When invoking this emanation, target up to 3 willing creatures, potentially including yourself. These creatures become psionically linked, gaining the following benefits:
- All linked creatures can communicate telepathically with other linked creatures
- All linked creatures' saving throw bonuses are replaced with the average of that bonus for all linked creatures.
If any linked creatures moves more than 60 feet away from the nearest linked creature, the link is broken and this emanation's effect ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: For every point of overclock, add an additional creature to the linkage.

spell.name: 「SPIRIT」
entries: Touch a creature while invoking this emanation. You become aware of the current location of the targeted creature's soul as long as you are in contact with the target.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: For each point of overclock, gain an additional bonus from the following:
- You can see from the soul's location while maintaining contact.
- You can hear any sounds around the soul's location
- You know what plane of existence the soul is on

spell.name: 「LINK」
entries: When invoking this emanation, target up to five creatures, potentially including yourself. The targets are psionically linked, gaining the following benefits:
- Linked creatures can communicate psychically with any other linked creatures.
- Psionic heat capacity is shared between linked creatures.
An unwilling creature may make an Intelligence Saving Throw against the initial effect of this emanation, as well as a save at the end of each of its turns.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: For every 2 points of overclock, add 1 target to the linkage.

spell.name: 「REFLECT」

time.condition: when a creature within range activates craft of tier 3 or below

entries: Interrupt the activation of the craft which triggered this effect. Then, you may reflect the craft's effect back upon its user (with you as its owner).

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: For every 2 points of overclock, raise the maximum tier of craft by 1.

spell.name: 「RAGE OF USTAR」
entries: Fly into a dark rage, emboldened by the Deadlord of Blood's power. While enraged this way, you gain the following effects:
- You are vulnerable to radiant damage and resistant to all other damage.
- You are unable to activate or concentrate spells or emanations
- You gain +2 damage with strength-based weapon attacks
- You receive a minimum of 2 attacks per attack action.

If you become {@condition incapacitated} or go a full round without taking or dealing damage this rage ends early. If this rage would end early this way, you can instead choose to extend it up to ten times.
At the end of the rage, you take one level of {@condition exhaustion} per rage extension.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: For every 2 points of overheat, you gain +1 damage with strength-based weapon attacks, and for every 4 points of overheat, you gain one more minimum attack per attack action.

spell.name: 「FUSION」
entries: When invoking this emanation, target up to 3 creatures in range, potentially including yourself. An unwilling target has the chance to make an Intelligence Saving Throw, repeating any time they take damage. The affected creatures are psionically linked, gaining the following effects:
- All linked creatures can communicate telepathically.
- Any psionic effect targeting a linked creature affects all linked creatures.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: For every 3 points of overclock, add another target to the linkage.

spell.name: 「DOMINION」
entries: While invoking this emanation, target a medium or smaller Beast of CR 1/4 or lower. A submind fragments from your consciousness and parasitically attaches to the target. A non-{@condition incapacitated} target can make an Intelligence Saving Throw against your psionics DC to prevent this effect.
While your submind is attached to a creature, it is directly controlled by you and can deliver your touch-based emanations.
By consuming 3 units of psionic sublimate, this connection can be severed, turning the target into an independent, psionic creature and ending this emanation's effect.
This emanation uses an ongoing effect; ongoing effects cost heat capacity instead of building up heat.

m.text: 3 units of psionic sublimate, consumed only on severing

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: For each point of overclock, increase CR by one step (0, 1/8, 1/4, 1, 2, 3...)

spell.name: 「DEVOUR」
entries: A dark emanation, shunned for its corrupting power.
While invoking this emanation, touch an {@condition incapacitated} humanoid creature. The target creature must make an Intelligence Saving Throw.
On a failed save, the caster reaches into the target's head, pulling out their brain and devouring it whole. This instantly kills the target and heals half of the invoker's heat buildup.
On a successful save, the caster is repulsed 30 feet away, and the target is no longer {@condition incapacitated}.
This emanation cannot be delivered by a submind, and invoking it is an explicitly Cosmic Chaotic Evil action with consequences.

spell.name: 「SUBLIMATE」
entries: An ancient, lost emanation.

While invoking this emanation, touch a creature. If the target fails an Intelligence Saving Throw against your psionics DC, it dies instantly as its body melts into pure psionic energy, leaving behind an amount of ashy, cold psionic sublimate scaling with their mental power.
Invoking this emanation immediately puts the user into a Stage 3 Psionic Crisis.

spell.name: 「IMBUE」
entries: A ritual emanation used in cultures where psychics are common.

While performing this ritual, target an unawakened humanoid within range. Over the course of this ritual, which often involves incense, music, or a shared meal, the invoker's psychic weave calls out to that of the target.

At the end of the ceremony, the target of this emanation consumes the sublimate used in the material component, orally, intravenously, in food, or by another delivery method. With their awakening, they are imprinted with one of the invoker's known emanations as well as their natural imprint.

spell.name: 「SEVER」
entries: An ancient emanation of the arcane tradition.

While invoking this emanation, touch an {@condition incapacitated} creature. This creature's connection to the weave is shattered, rendering it incapable of casting spells. This effect can only be dispelled by a {@spell wish} spell or similar effect.

spell.name: 「CORE」
entries: When invoking this emanation, gain 2 sorcery points.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: For each point of overclock, gain 1 more sorcery point.

spell.name: 「STARS」
entries: A raw emanation, pulled in through The Living Gate.

Touch a creature while invoking this emanation to attack them with eldritch knowledge beyond their comprehension. The targeted creature must make an Intelligence Saving Throw. On a failure, the target takes on a level of Short Term Madness. If the target fails this save by 5 or more, they instead take a level of Long Term Madness.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: For each point of overclock, lower the DC gap by 1.

spell.name: 「COMMUNION WITH SANDS」
entries: An Anaurian emanation imprinted upon a {@item sharn amulet}.
While channeling this emanation, the invoker must be in contact with a connected piece of the sands of Anauroch.

The invoker psionically connects with the desert of Anauroch and can ask it three questions. It is under no compulsion to answer truthfully, and it has its own judgement as to whether helping you fits its own interests.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: For each point of overclock, drop the invocation time by one step.
(1 hour, 1 minute, 1 round, 1 action, 1 bonus action)

spell.name: 「GRAVITY」
entries: While invoking this emanation, make a melee attack. On a hit, the target of this attack must make an Intelligence Saving Throw. On a failed save, the target is trapped within your psionic gravity and unable to willingly move out of your melee range.
The target can repeat this save at the end of each of its turns.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: For every 2 points of overclock, add one more maximum target. (Up to your Attack Action multiplicity.)

spell.name: 「HONE」
entries: While this emanation is ongoing, your heightened predatory instincts increase your critical range by 1.
This emanation uses an ongoing effect; ongoing effects cost heat capacity instead of building up heat.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: For every 3 points of overclock, increase critical range by 1 more.

spell.name: 「BRAND」
entries: When invoking this emanation, target a creature within range. A submind splits off from your consciousness and attaches to that creature.
If the target isn't awakened or failed its save, the submind latches onto the target's psyche. As long as the submind is attached this way, you gain the following benefits while within 100 feet:
- You know where the target is and what way it is moving
- You know if the target is aware of your presence

A psionic target can make an Intelligence Saving Throw to resist the submind's presence, with the option to repeat this save once every 24 hours. An non-psionic creature can determine the presence of the sensor using a successful Intelligence (Investigation) check and attempt to shut it out using an Intelligence Saving Throw.
This emanation uses an ongoing effect; ongoing effects cost heat capacity instead of building up heat.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: For each point of overclock, add one of the following effects (each effect can be chosen multiple times):
- Add another submind, targeting the same or a different creature
- Increase the tracking range by 20 feet.

spell.name: Extract Moisture
entries: While casting this spell, target a cube of non-living non-magical matter no more than 10 feet on each side.

Over the duration of the spell, all hydration is pulled out of the targeted matter and condensed into a ball of elemental water, protected by a thin membrane that can be easily pierced with a needle or tooth.

spell.name: Painkill
entries: Touch a creature while casting this spell. The targeted creature is numbed against pain and will no longer become {@condition unconscious} when reaching 0 hit points for the duration. At the end of the duration, the target takes one level of {@condition exhaustion|TomboftheMummyKingsContent}.
If the targeted creature reaches a negative hit points value equal to their maximum hit points, they die as usual.

condition.name: Exhaustion
entries: Some special abilities and environmental hazards, such as starvation and the long-term effects of freezing or scorching temperatures, can lead to a special condition called exhaustion. Exhaustion is measured in ten levels. An effect can give a creature one or more levels of exhaustion, as specified in the effect's description.
For each level of exhaustion, a creature suffers a -1 penalty to their attack rolls, skill checks, and save DCs for supernatural effects.
If an already exhausted creature suffers another effect that causes exhaustion, its current level of exhaustion increases by the amount specified in the effect's description.

Finishing a long rest reduces a creature's exhaustion level by 1, provided that the creature has also ingested some food and drink. Also, being raised from the dead reduces a creature's exhaustion level by 1.

condition.name: Coated in Acid
entries: A creature coated in acid takes 1d6 acid damage at the start of each of their turns for 1 minute. A creature can use its action to wipe acid off of itself or another creature.

condition.name: Fuzzy
entries: Effects involving alcohol or mundane mind-altering substances will often cause the Fuzzy condition, a special kind of poisoning.
A fuzzy creature has disadvantage on Dexterity Saving throws and Charisma checks, as well as advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

contents.name: Travel in a Sentient, Evil Desert

entries.name: Psionics Rules
entries: All living creatures in the Forgotten Realms have a psionic potential. This potential can be awakened using psionic sublimate, a purple crystalline substance made up of pure psionic potential. An awakened creature is capable of invoking psionic emanations, which project their personal psychic weave onto the world in different ways. On their awakening, a creature receives a starting emanation, the imprint of their personal psychic weave.

Invoking a psionic emanation builds up Neural Heat equal to the sum of its level and overclock, and a psycker's Neural Heat Capacity increases as they consume more sublimate according to the Heat Capacity Table below. A psycker is capable of going over their heat capacity, but there are unpredicable consequences for doing so.
Any psionic emanation invoked on the Ethereal Plane automatically receives 3 levels of overclock at no heat cost.

entries.name: Common Psionics Verbs
entries: Many psionic emanations include variations on the same basic concepts. A non-exhaustive list is included below.

entries.caption: Psionics Verbs
rows: Link emanations create a psionic connection between individuals. Linked individuals can always communicate psionically, among other effects stated in the emanation's description.
Submind emanations create new micro-consciousnesses using the invoker's psychic power. These subminds can usually be released as independent minds by consuming psionic sublimate.

data.name: Travel in a Sentient, Evil Desert

entries.name: Travel in a Sentient, Evil Desert
entries: In the cruel environs of Anauroch, basic travel is taxing and drains on the soul. For every stretch of travel, all travelling players participate in a Skill Challenge:

For every day of travel, each traveller needs a course of action in the form of a skill check. Each member makes a check for every day of the travel. Assuming a travelling party of five, every 3 failed checks results in one level of exhaustion for the entire party, as they work harder to deal with their teammates' shortcomings.

Once exhaustion has been handled, pick a party member to roll a D12 for each day of travel. If any of the rolls are within the critical range, a random encounter is triggered. Only one random encounter can trigger in a single stretch of travel.

item.name: Alchemical Pressure Gasket
entries: This complicated gizmo augments an {@item alchemy jug|dmg}, upgrading to an {@item alchemy cannon|TomboftheMummyKingsContent}
Applying or removing this augment takes one hour of uninterrupted tinkering by a user with proficiency in alchemical supplies.

item.name: Boots of Leaping
entries: This trinket imported from Baldur's Gate augments the wearer's jumps.

The attuned creature can jump twice as far and, by using a bonus action, can jump their entire jump distance for a maximum of 20 feet of movement. Reference the Jumping Distance table below to review.

entries.caption: Jumping Distance, (Boots of Leaping)
rows: Feet equal to 2 x Strength Score
Feet equal to Half of Strength Score, rounded down
Feet equal to 2 x Strength Score, rounded down
Feet equal to Half strength Score, rounded down

item.name: Alchemical Cannon
entries: This augmented {@item alchemy jug | dmg} fires its contents in a pressurized stream. Once per day, you can set a dial and release this pressure to activate one of the following effects:

entries.caption: Alchemy Cannon Options
rows: Fire a 20 ft. line of acid, all creatures in range take 2d6 acid damage and are {@condition coated in acid}.
Fire three bursts of poison, all targeted creatures make a Constitution save against being {@condition poisoned}, resaving at the end of their turns.
Fire a 30 ft. cone of pressurized beer, every creature inside makes a Dexterity Saving Throw against being {@condition fuzzy}, resaving with Constitution at the end of their turns.

Fire a 20 ft. line of sticky honey, every creature in the line must make a Dexterity Saving Throw against the effects of the {@spell Slow} spell, resaving at the end of their turns. This trap remains for 1 minute.

Fire a 30 ft. cone of non-flammable grease, creatures in the line must make a Dexterity Saving Throw against slipping and falling {@condition prone}. This trap remains for 1 minute, unless washed off.

Fire into the air to create a 10 ft. circular slick of flammable oil, centered within 60 feet of the cannon. Creatures in the circle must make a Dexterity Saving Throw against slipping and falling {@condition prone}. The slick remains until ignited, at which point it lasts 18 seconds. The ignited slick deals 1d6 fire damage to those inside every turn.
Fire a 30 ft. cone of vinegar, creatures in the cone must make a Dexterity Saving Throw against going {@condition blind}, resaving at the end of their turns.
Fire a 60 ft geyser of water which sweeps into a 60 ft cone, creatures in the cone take 1d6 bludgeoning damage and make a Strength Saving throw against being pushed back 15 feet.
Fire a stream of freshwater, washing anything within a 30 foot sphere. Any liquid surface or coating effect within that region can be washed away.

Fire a burst of firewine onto a creature within 30 feet. When that creature is next hit with fire damage, the wine explodes in a 10 foot sphere, dealing the damage of the attack which triggered the explosion. This explosion hits the soaked creature, as well.

entries: The DC for an alchemy cannon attack is equal to the user's Intelligence spell DC.

item.name: Energy Pellet
entries: These compressed medicinal pellets typically come in packs of three. A creature can take six seconds to dissolve one pellet under its tongue, removing one level of exhaustion.

item.name: Super Energy Pellet
entries: These limited edition medicinal pellets typically come in packs of three. A creature can take six seconds to dissolve one pellet under its tongue, removing all levels of exhaustion.
Has a slight taste of saffron.

item.name: Potion of Hill Giant Intelligence
entries: Drinking this potion sets your intelligence to 5 (-3) for one hour.

item.name: Butcher's Knife
entries: The wielder of this knife gains a +2 to all checks which involve dissecting dead creatures, including attacks against the undead.

item.name: Arquebus
entries: A primitive firearm prototyped by Abeiran gnome clans. Most arquebi on Toril are shoddy forgeries of these original designs.
Loading a bullet and powder into this weapon takes ten minutes for a layman, one minute for someone proficient, and one action for someone with the {@feat gunner} feat.

item.name: Glaive of the Empty Tomb
entries: The shaft of this black-iron glaive is wrapped in funerary cloth soaked in annointing oils with the faint smell of lavender.
When making an attack with this weapon, the user can spend one spell slot of 1st level or higher to convert the attack's damage to healing.

Embedded in the glaive's pommel is a fractured diamond consecrated by clerics of Kelemvor. This diamond can be crushed in one hand, and sprinkling its remains over a recently deceased creature will apply the effects of {@spell revivify}.

item.name: Guiding Moonlight
entries: This silver longbow is inscribed with prayers to Selune, written in glowing elven script.
When making an attack with this weapon, the wielder can speak a command word to replace the arrow with a {@spell guiding bolt}. This ability can be used once per day, recharging at midnight.
On the night of Selune's full moon, the bow becomes overcharged until its next use, increasing the level of {@spell guiding bolt} use this way from 1 to 2.
This bow lets off dim light within 15 feet and bright light within 5 feet.

item.name: Iron Gate
entries: This imposing wall of metal is engraved with warding runes, holding otherworldly evil at bay.

When an aberration, elemental, or fiend misses an attack against the wielder of this shield, they must make a DC 15 wisdom save or become {@condition frightened}, repeating at the end of their turns on failure.
Once per day, recharging at dawn, the wielder of this shield can use it to cast {@spell death ward} on themself.

item.name: Hydra Salve
entries: This thick, tacky glue comes in a small adamantine tin and smells strongly of rotting balsam.

Spreading this substance on an open wound allows any detached biological limb to bind to the wound site as if it were a part of the wounded creature's body. After a day of setting, the creature slowly gains use of the limb over the next three days.
The effects of this are unpredictable, often dangerous, and almost always profane.

disease.name: Talona's Embrace
entries: Talona's Embrace is the formal term for the plague sweeping the West-Anaurian Duchy of Gisselarre. Common folk refer to it as 'The Sand Plague' due to its magical effects on stone and sand exposed to the plague.

Infection is spread by exposure to infected bodily fluids and infected material. Within three days of exposure, victims develop a necrotizing rash. As the disease progresses, the infected's mind becomes clouded, and become violent without even noticing it. Within a tenday of infection, the infected's skin begins to slough off in infectious plague boluses.
By the second tenday, the infected loses their original personality and becomes a Cosmic Chaotic Evil plague-thrall with no goal beyond spreading the disease and serving any undead master they have.

makebrewCreatureTrait.name: Grasp of Talona
entries: When this creature dies, it explodes in a cloud of dark pestilence. Creatures within 10 feet must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity Saving Throw or take {@damage 2d6} acid damage on a failed save or half on a successful one.
A creature who fails this saving throw must make a {@dc 16} Constitution Saving Throw or become infected with the initial stages of {@disease Talona's Embrace}.
